description: Machine-readable source-of-truth index for the docs/ folder. Use this to map docs to audiences, priorities, and related code modules.

sections.title: Index / Table of Contents
sections.description: Top-level site index and Table of Contents linking to all major guides, references, and sections in the docs site.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.description: Project overview, goals, terminology, and a short value proposition describing what the vector database does and when to use it.

sections.title: Installation
sections.description: Step-by-step installation instructions for different platforms (Linux, Windows, macOS), optional dependencies, and build-from-source guidance including CMake and vcpkg usage.

sections.title: Quickstart
sections.description: Minimal end-to-end example that gets a database initialized, ingests a small dataset, runs a search, and shows expected outputs â€” ideal for first-time trial runs.

sections.title: User Guide
sections.description: Detailed usage patterns, configuration options, examples of common tasks (ingest, query, export), and recommended workflows for users and integrators.

sections.title: Architecture
sections.description: High-level system architecture, component diagrams, data flow, interaction between storage, index, embedding, and serving layers, and scaling considerations.

sections.title: Data Formats
sections.description: Canonical list of supported data formats (JSONL, CSV, PDF, DOCX, Parquet, etc.), expected metadata fields, chunking heuristics, and examples for converting upstream data into the project's canonical format.

sections.title: Data Ingestion
sections.description: End-to-end ingestion guide covering adapters, chunking strategies, parallel workers, format autodetection, error handling, and monitoring of ingestion jobs.

sections.title: Embeddings Models
sections.description: Supported embedding models, how to plug new models (ONNX/TensorFlow/PyTorch), batching considerations, model download instructions, and best practices for dimension/normalization.

sections.title: Vector Operations
sections.description: Semantics and examples for vector-level operations (normalization, cosine/dot product, distance metrics), vector CRUD lifecycle, and how operations map to storage and index layers.

sections.title: Hybrid Search
sections.description: Design and algorithms behind combining lexical (BM25) and vector similarity, fusion strategies (RRF, weighted sum), and tuning vector/text weights for precision/recall tradeoffs.

sections.title: AI Training
sections.description: Procedures and examples for training or fine-tuning models used in the stack, including data generation for contrastive/triplet losses and integration with export utilities.

sections.title: ML Framework
sections.description: Internal ML framework components, supported runtimes (PyTorch, TensorFlow, ONNX), model adapter interfaces, and how to add new training or serving backends.

sections.title: LLM Engine
sections.description: Architecture of the LLM integration layer, prompts and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) patterns, and connector examples for local and remote model runtimes.

sections.title: Quantization
sections.description: Quantization strategies supported (scalar, product, perceptual), how quantization affects recall/speed/size, and tools to evaluate and apply quantization to stored vectors.

sections.title: Logging & Monitoring
sections.description: Logging levels, structured logging format, metrics exposed, recommended Prometheus/Grafana dashboards, and guidance for alerting and SLOs.

sections.title: OpenTelemetry Installation
sections.description: Installation steps and configuration snippets to enable OpenTelemetry instrumentation and collection for services and client SDKs used by the project.

sections.title: OpenTelemetry Tracing
sections.description: Tracing design, span conventions, and examples of instrumenting ingestion, search, and API requests with OpenTelemetry semantics.

sections.title: eBPF Observability
sections.description: Notes and examples using eBPF for low-level observability, syscall tracing, and performance profiling in production environments.

sections.title: Deployment
sections.description: Deployment recipes for single-node and cluster deployments, Kubernetes manifests, container images, and recommended resource requests/limits.

sections.title: HTTP Adapter
sections.description: HTTP API surface, routes, authentication/authorization patterns, and examples for calling the API from clients and the UI.

sections.title: Performance Tuning
sections.description: Practical guidance for optimizing throughput and latency: index parameters, memory configurations, storage backends, and profiling tips.

sections.title: Advanced Features
sections.description: Deep-dive features and experimental capabilities not required for basic usage, with warnings and migration tips.

sections.title: Security
sections.description: Security model, authentication and authorization recommendations, secrets handling, and hardening guidance for production deployments.

sections.title: API Reference
sections.description: Comprehensive API reference for HTTP endpoints and client bindings including parameter descriptions, request/response examples, and error codes.

sections.title: Usage Examples
sections.description: Curated examples and recipes for real-world tasks: semantic search, hybrid workflows, exporting training data, and integrating with LLMs.

sections.title: Python Bindings
sections.description: How to install and use the Python bindings, examples of common operations, and notes on building and packaging the Python wheel.

sections.title: Custom Development
sections.description: Developer-oriented guidance for extending the system: adding adapters, index types, embeddings models, and contributing code.

sections.title: Contributing
sections.description: Contribution workflow, coding standards, testing guidelines, PR etiquette, and release tagging policies.

notes.summary: This file is intended as a machine-readable index for tooling: TOC generators, link-checkers, docs sync tasks, and CI validation. Fields: id, path, title, audience, priority, status, related_code.

recommended_actions.description: Create mapping from key docs to source modules (API, ingestion, embeddings).
Run and CI-verify Quickstart and Usage Examples to prevent bit-rot.
Run automated internal/external link checker and update `status` fields accordingly.
Populate `last_reviewed` and `last_synced_with_release` per-section in future updates.

commands.name: init
commands.description: Initialize a new database at <path>. Creates config.json, vectors.bin, and metadata.json with default settings.

commands.name: info
commands.description: Show database information (vector count, status, config).

commands.name: optimize
commands.description: Compact storage, rebuild indexes, and free space optimizations.

commands.name: backup
commands.description: Create a backup of a database directory to the destination path.

commands.name: restore
commands.description: Restore a database from a backup file to the target path.

commands.name: health
commands.description: Run health checks and return a summary of database integrity and resource usage.

commands.name: db:list
commands.description: List discovered databases under the provided path.

commands.name: add
commands.description: Add a single document to the database using inline text or a file.

commands.name: get
commands.description: Retrieve a document by ID from the database.

commands.name: update
commands.description: Update an existing document's metadata or text.

commands.name: delete
commands.description: Delete a document by ID (alias: rm).

commands.name: batch
commands.description: Insert documents in batch from a file (e.g., JSONL).

commands.name: list
commands.description: List documents in the database with optional limit.

commands.name: search
commands.description: Semantic vector search for nearest documents to the query.

commands.name: hybrid:search
commands.description: Hybrid search combining vector similarity and BM25 lexical signals.

commands.name: hybrid:bm25
commands.description: BM25 full-text search only.

commands.name: ingest
commands.description: Import external data sources into the database using adapters and chunking strategies.

commands.name: ingest:scan
commands.description: Scan a source to preview documents and estimate chunks without importing.

commands.name: index:build
commands.description: Build or rebuild an index for the database (HNSW supported).

commands.name: index:optimize
commands.description: Optimize index data structures for faster search.

commands.name: index:stats
commands.description: Show statistics about the index (memory, params, recall).

commands.name: index:benchmark
commands.description: Run index performance benchmarks with sample queries.

commands.name: collection:create
commands.description: Create a new collection namespace inside a database.

commands.name: collection:list
commands.description: List collections available in the database.

commands.name: collection:delete
commands.description: Delete a named collection; confirmation required unless --force is used.

commands.name: collection:info
commands.description: Show metadata and stats for a specific collection.

commands.name: export:data
commands.description: Export database documents (optionally with vectors) to a file.

commands.name: export:pairs
commands.description: Export training pairs for model training.

commands.name: export:triplets
commands.description: Export triplets for contrastive training.

commands.name: shell
commands.description: Start the interactive REPL shell for exploratory operations.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Show CLI help and available commands.

commands.name: version
commands.description: Show version and build information.
